title: Does the size of a monitor include bezels? Or is it the size of the screen? - Quora

response.answer_text: Modern monitor measurements are corner-to-corner diagonally of the glass screen. However, companies claim “class” of monitor size (19″, 22″, 24″, 27″, 32″) now. Slightly different aspect ratios make the measurements slightly off and it would confuse consumers with yet another spec detail.

Here's an oddity, screen size measurements are often weird and wrong. You can expect the diagonal measurement to be approximate, they are a category more than a specification. If you want to know the exact size you should check the product specification which will tell you the exact dimensions horizontally and vertically.
